question: What is the name of the workshop focusing on optimizing directory structures?
answer: The workshop is named "Data Bites - Optimize Directory Structures for Research Data."

question: Who is delivering the "Data Bites - Optimize Directory Structures for Research Data" workshop?
answer: The "Data Bites - Optimize Directory Structures for Research Data" workshop is delivered by the UBC Library Research Data Management team.

question: What date and time is the "Data Bites - Optimize Directory Structures for Research Data" workshop scheduled for?
answer: The "Data Bites - Optimize Directory Structures for Research Data" workshop is scheduled for October 1, 2025, from 18:30:00 UTC to 19:00:00 UTC.

question: What is the duration of the "Data Bites - Optimize Directory Structures for Research Data" workshop?
answer: The "Data Bites - Optimize Directory Structures for Research Data" workshop has a duration of 30 minutes.

question: Who is the "Data Bites - Optimize Directory Structures for Research Data" workshop designed for?
answer: The workshop "Data Bites - Optimize Directory Structures for Research Data" is designed for graduate students, researchers, and staff.

question: What will participants learn in the "Data Bites - Optimize Directory Structures for Research Data" workshop?
answer: Participants will learn how to design directory structures, implement naming and hierarchy conventions, and apply best practices to maintain consistency and clarity throughout the research lifecycle.

question: Where will the "Data Bites - Optimize Directory Structures for Research Data" workshop take place?
answer: The "Data Bites - Optimize Directory Structures for Research Data" workshop will take place ONLINE.

question: How will registrants receive the Zoom link for the "Data Bites - Optimize Directory Structures for Research Data" event?
answer: A Zoom link will be sent to registrants 3 hours before the "Data Bites - Optimize Directory Structures for Research Data" event starts.

question: Who is the organizer of the "Data Bites - Optimize Directory Structures for Research Data" event?
answer: Eugene Barsky is the organizer of the "Data Bites - Optimize Directory Structures for Research Data" event.

question: What keywords are associated with the "Data Bites - Optimize Directory Structures for Research Data" event?
answer: Keywords associated with the "Data Bites - Optimize Directory Structures for Research Data" event include Data, Digital Scholarship, Research Commons, and Research Data Management.

question: What is the URL for more information about "Data Bites - Optimize Directory Structures for Research Data"?
answer: The URL for more information about "Data Bites - Optimize Directory Structures for Research Data" is https://libcal.library.ubc.ca/event/3919630.

question: What is the title of the event scheduled for October 1, 2025, from 19:00 to 21:00 UTC?
answer: The event scheduled for October 1, 2025, from 19:00 to 21:00 UTC is "Introduction to OpenRefine."

question: What tool will be introduced in the "Introduction to OpenRefine" session?
answer: The "Introduction to OpenRefine" session will introduce OpenRefine, a powerful, free and open-source tool for working with large datasets.

question: What skills are required to attend the "Introduction to OpenRefine" session?
answer: The "Introduction to OpenRefine" session is suitable for beginners with no prior knowledge of OpenRefine and no prerequisite coding skills.

question: What will participants learn to do with OpenRefine?
answer: Participants will learn how to use OpenRefine to effectively clean and format tabular data while automatically tracking any changes.

question: Is the "Introduction to OpenRefine" session only for the Humanities and Social Sciences community?
answer: While the examples and data used in the "Introduction to OpenRefine" session are aimed at the Humanities and Social Sciences community, the session is open to anyone interested in learning about OpenRefine.

question: Where can I find the registration form for "Introduction to OpenRefine"?
answer: The registration form for "Introduction to OpenRefine" is available at https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScgRExotIHxD1V9Zc9NO-FXs-PvUIst0Ew7Is-ofzd8kc3uTg/viewform.

question: What keyword is associated with the "Introduction to OpenRefine" event?
answer: The keyword associated with the "Introduction to OpenRefine" event is "Social Sciences."

question: Where can participants find other courses in the series that includes "Introduction to OpenRefine"?
answer: Other courses in the series can be found at https://www.ualberta.ca/en/information-services-and-technology/research-computing/bootcamps.html.
